surfSpots.name: Windansea Beach
surfSpots.description: Located in the southern part of La Jolla, Windansea Beach is famous for its powerful waves and reef breaks.

surfSpots.name: Scripps Pier
surfSpots.description: Scripps Pier offers consistent waves and is popular among both longboarders and shortboarders.

surfSpots.name: Black's Beach
surfSpots.description: Black's Beach is known for its stunning beauty and challenging surf conditions. It is one of Southern California's most famous surf spots.

surfSpots.name: La Jolla Shores
surfSpots.description: La Jolla Shores is a popular spot for beginners and offers a sandy bottom and gentle waves.

surfSpots.name: Horseshoe
surfSpots.description: Horseshoe is a reef break that offers powerful and fast waves, recommended for experienced surfers.

surfSpots.name: Tourmaline Surfing Park
surfSpots.description: Tourmaline Surfing Park is a great spot for all skill levels, with both left and right-hand waves.

surfSpots.name: Marine Street Beach
surfSpots.description: Marine Street Beach is known for its consistent waves and is suitable for all skill levels.

surfSpots.name: Bird Rock
surfSpots.description: Bird Rock is a reef break that offers powerful waves and is recommended for experienced surfers.

surfSpots.name: The Clam
surfSpots.description: The Clam is a point break known for its long, clean waves that are ideal for longboarders.

surfSpots.name: Hospital Point
surfSpots.description: Hospital Point is a reef break that offers fast and hollow waves, suitable for experienced surfers.
